key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA fares match SWISS website rates in 83.8% of cases, with average price gaps within ±0.2% and markups declining to 2.3% of listings.
MSE undercuts SWISS website pricing in 89.5% of itineraries, offering an average 4% discount while parity has slipped to just 3.1%.
GDS fares are higher than SWISS website rates in 92.6% of cases, with a stable +0.36% average premium and negligible lower‐priced instances.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Approximately 83.8% of fares on the OTA channel match website rates, reflecting a 1.3-point increase week over week and a 4.2-point rise month over month.
Routes priced higher on OTA account for only 2.3% of bookings, down from 3.4% last week and 6.0% the prior month, indicating reduced markup occurrences.
When differences occur, average premiums are just +0.15% and discounts –0.03%, signifying tight pricing alignment.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 9.2% of itineraries are not listed on OTA, a 0.15-point decline week over week and 0.22-point drop month over month.
Fares align on both platforms in 83.8% of cases, up 1.26 points week over week and 4.20 points month over month, showing strengthening parity.
Markups appear in 2.33% of itineraries, down 1.06 points week over week and 3.65 points month over month, with an average premium of +0.15%.
Discounted fares account for 4.66% of listings, virtually flat week over week, with an average markdown of -0.03%.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 83.4% of short-haul fares match website rates, up 1.29 points week over week, while OTA higher pricing dropped to 2.34%.
Long-haul itineraries exhibit 100% fare parity, improving from 97.9% last week and eliminating any OTA markups.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Routes originating in Switzerland show the highest parity at 88.9%, up 2.77 points week over week, with OTA markups at only 2.14%.
Non-Swiss routes see 78.7% parity and 9.19% discounted fares, indicating greater deviation than domestic origins.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 81.1% of close-in bookings align on both channels, a 1.41-point increase week over week, and OTA lower fares have decreased slightly to 6.11%.
Far-out bookings show 89.16% parity, up 0.99 points week over week, while OTA markups fell to 0.95% and discounts remain low at 1.90%.

mse_highlights.line_content: In the latest week, MSE offered lower prices than SWISS’s website in 89.5% of itineraries, up 1.39pp over the past month, averaging a 4% discount.
Price parity on MSE fell to 3.1% in the latest week, down 0.84pp month-on-month, indicating fewer matched offers.
MSE premiums were virtually nonexistent at 0.00% last week, though when they occurred, prices averaged 2% above website rates.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: In 7.43% of itineraries last week, SWISS fares were unavailable on MSE, a slight rise of 0.09pp week-on-week and a 0.49pp decline month-on-month.
Parity occurred in 3.08% of cases last week, down 0.11pp week-on-week and 0.84pp month-on-month, reflecting a shrinking match rate.
MSE prices were lower in 89.49% of itineraries last week, up 0.09pp from the prior week and 1.39pp over the month, averaging a 4% discount.
MSE prices higher than the website were extremely rare at 0.00% last week, with averaged premiums of +2% week-on-week and +19% month-on-month in those instances.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: On short-haul routes, MSE undercut website pricing in 89.36% of itineraries last week, up 1.43pp month-on-month, delivering a 4% average discount.
In long-haul segments, price parity surged to 6.25% last week (+4.17pp week-on-week), while discount frequency dipped by 4.17pp, indicating a shift toward matched pricing.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For CH origins, 90.31% of MSE bookings were priced below the website last week, stable week-on-week and +2.18pp month-on-month, with a 3% average discount.
Non-CH origins saw MSE undercut the website in 88.66% of itineraries last week (up 0.60pp month-on-month), maintaining an average 4% lower price.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings experienced MSE discounts in 88.62% of cases last week (+1.67pp month-on-month) with an average 4% price reduction.
Far-out itineraries registered the highest discount rate at 91.25% last week, though down 0.23pp week-on-week, sustaining a 3% average reduction.

gds_highlights.line_content: 92.6% of itineraries were priced higher in GDS last week, marking a 0.1pp week-on-week and 0.4pp month-on-month increase.
The average GDS fare premium held steady at approximately +0.36% versus the website across all routes last week and prior periods.
Offers missing in GDS comprised 7.43% of cases (down 0.37pp m/m), while lower-priced GDS instances remain negligible.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: GDS lacked offers for 7.43% of itineraries last week, a 0.37pp decline compared to the previous month.
No itineraries (0%) showed identical pricing between the GDS and the website, unchanged from prior periods.
92.57% of itineraries were priced higher in GDS last week, marking a 0.43pp increase from last month with an average premium of 0.36%.
Instances of lower GDS pricing were virtually nonexistent at 0% last week, down 0.06pp from the previous month with an average discount of 0.06%.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes saw 92.34% of fares higher in GDS last week with a 0.37% average premium; missing offers stood at 7.66%, down 0.37pp month-on-month.
All long-haul itineraries (100%) were priced higher in GDS with a modest 0.04% premium, reflecting no variation week-over-week or month-over-month.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Swiss-origin itineraries (CH) were 92.70% higher in GDS last week with a 0.34% premium, while missing offers dropped 0.49pp to 7.30% m/m.
Non-Swiss origins saw 92.43% GDS higher pricing at a 0.39% premium, with missing offers rising 0.18pp w/w to 7.57%.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Fares booked close to departure showed 92.47% GDS higher frequency with a 0.30% average premium, and missing offers at 7.53%, down 0.06pp w/w.
Far-out bookings exhibited the highest GDS premium at 0.49% and a 92.76% higher rate, with missing offers at 7.24%, up 0.20pp w/w and down 1.30pp m/m.
